intro: Uvaria nervosa, commonly known as the slender cow-itch vine, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia and Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, ovate leaves with prominent veins. Its flowers are small, clustered in cymes, and typically have four to five petals. The fruit is a small, fleshy drupe that contains a single seed.
